com.roobo.vui.common.pipe

Class EasyBufferingPipe<AudioChunkType extends com.nuance.dragon.toolkit.audio.AbstractAudioChunk>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nuance.dragon.toolkit.audio.AudioSource<OutputType>
      • com.nuance.dragon.toolkit.audio.AudioPipe<InputType,OutputType>
        • com.nuance.dragon.toolkit.audio.pipes.SingleSinkPipe<AudioChunkType,AudioChunkType>
          • com.roobo.vui.common.pipe.EasyBufferingPipe<AudioChunkType>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CloudRecognizePipe

    public class EasyBufferingPipe<AudioChunkType extends com.nuance.dragon.toolkit.audio.AbstractAudioChunk>
extends com.nuance.dragon.toolkit.audio.pipes.SingleSinkPipe<AudioChunkType,AudioChunkType>
    A basic audio pipe that consumes audio as fast as possible from its source, and buffers it here. And it also provides some functions to operate on audio data.

        public EasyBufferingPipe(com.nuance.dragon.toolkit.audio.AudioType expectedAudioType)
        BufferingPipe constructor
        Parameters:
        expectedAudioType - The expected audio type of the chunks for this pipe.

      • EasyBufferingPipe

        public EasyBufferingPipe(com.nuance.dragon.toolkit.audio.AudioType expectedAudioType,
                         int maxDuration)
        BufferingPipe constructor
        Parameters:
        expectedAudioType - The expected audio type of the chunks for this pipe.
        maxDuration - The duration (in ms.) after when non consumed audio is considered too old and cleared, or -1 to never clear the pipe. Default is -1.

      • clearBuffersBeforeTimestamp

        public void clearBuffersBeforeTimestamp(long timestamp)
        Clear the audio buffered up before a certain timestamp.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp value (in ms.). You may want to substract an extra padding duration for time data returned by the recognizers.

      • clearBuffersAfterTimestamp

        public void clearBuffersAfterTimestamp(long timestamp)
        Clear the audio buffered down after a certain timestamp.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp value (in ms.). You may want to substract an extra padding duration for time data returned by the recognizers.
